channel.title: Comments on: Application Event Log for your website
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Tahir Khalid
item.dc:creator: Tahir Khalid
item.description: NLog ftw - I use this library a lot now seeing it's ten times better Log4Net and makes the whole affair of logging various types of events an easy affair.
item.content:encoded: NLog ftw – I use this library a lot now seeing it’s ten times better Log4Net and makes the whole affair of logging various types of events an easy affair.

item.title: By: pmch22
item.dc:creator: pmch22
item.description: Thanks for the comment ca8msm . I have changed the code to GetLastError.GetBaseException().
item.content:encoded: Thanks for the comment ca8msm . I have changed the code to GetLastError.GetBaseException().

item.title: By: ca8msm
item.dc:creator: ca8msm
item.description: Depending on how the error surfaces, GetLastError may not actually return enough information for you. I'd consider changing it to use GetLastError.GetBaseException().
item.content:encoded: Depending on how the error surfaces, GetLastError may not actually return enough information for you. I’d consider changing it to use GetLastError.GetBaseException().

item.title: By: Mike
item.dc:creator: Mike
item.content:encoded:
You’ve got to take a peak at the open source (FREE) http://groups.google.com/group/elmah.

I heard of this and now all the web sites by my company use it. It is part of our standard setup of a web site. I love it. I drop a DLL into my project, create the database (or reuse existing one) and add a few entries in my web.config.
